Class Generation

java.lang.Object
Generation
public class Generation
extends java.lang.Object
Generation defines a Generation with the given states (1, 0) at a fixed time Each Generation encapsulates a boolean array that represents the cell states The cells are indexed from left to right starting at zero Maria Doan helped me fix getStates (String, char)
Author:
Baraa Ahmad

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Generation​(boolean... states)
    A Generation is a row in the ECA with a collection of "cells", each a unique value of true or false.
    Generation​(java.lang.String states, char trueSymbol)
    Create a Generation with one cell for each character in the given String ('1','0', etc).

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean getState​(int idx)
    Return the state of the cell with the given index.
    boolean[] getStates()
    Return an array with all of the cell states and ensures its immutable so that its values remain unique for the generation This is essential when defining a Generation and evolving, so that the previous Generation (row) does not change as well.
    java.lang.String getStates​(char falseSymbol, char trueSymbol)
    this returns the String format of a true or false value of each state.
    int size()
    This method returns the current size of the cellStates array.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Generation

      public Generation​(boolean... states)
      A Generation is a row in the ECA with a collection of "cells", each a unique value of true or false. The state of each cell is specified by the value of the corresponding element. If the array is empty or the method is given a null reference, create a Generation with one cell in the false state. To ensure there is no IndexOutOfBoundsException, set cellStates equal to the length of states after it passes the null check.
      Parameters:
      states - an arbitrary number of boolean states that are wrapped in an array

    • Generation

      public Generation​(java.lang.String states, char trueSymbol)
      Create a Generation with one cell for each character in the given String ('1','0', etc). If the char value in the specific position of the string equal to an index in cellStates is '0' or '1', its boolean value will be assigned accordingly. If the String is empty ("") or the method is given a null reference, a Generation with one cell in the false state is created.
      Parameters:
      states - collection of 1s and 0s that will be evaluated to determine the state of each cell
      trueSymbolthe - '1' or 'T' that indicates the cell has a true state.

  • Method Details

    • getState

      public boolean getState​(int idx)
      Return the state of the cell with the given index.
      Parameters:
      idx - the specific index of the cellStates array that it wants its state value (1 or 0).
      Returns:
      return the state of that element.

    • getStates

      public boolean[] getStates()
      Return an array with all of the cell states and ensures its immutable so that its values remain unique for the generation This is essential when defining a Generation and evolving, so that the previous Generation (row) does not change as well.
      Returns:
      return an immutable copy of the current Generation

    • getStates

      public java.lang.String getStates​(char falseSymbol, char trueSymbol)
      this returns the String format of a true or false value of each state. It evaluates every index of cellStates that exists, and assigns that index to true or false, depending on its value ( 1 or 0 ). It then returns that String representation of the symbols ('F' or 'T').
      Parameters:
      falseSymbol - the value of a cell in the false state.
      trueSymbol - the value of a cell in the true state.
      Returns:
      return the evaluated symbol

    • size

      public int size()
      This method returns the current size of the cellStates array.
      Returns:
      returns current size of the cellStates array.
